title: France is still trading uranium with Russia, nearly four years after Ukraine invasion
subhead: With uranium still spared from European Commission sanctions against Russia, the anti-nuclear NGO Greenpeace has highlighted that France remains tied to the Russian group Rosatom.

title: Capgemini in turmoil over its work with ICE
Greenland threat is a 'strategic wake-up call for all of Europe,' says Macron
Iran in collective shock after bloody crackdown
subhead: Even though internet access remains mostly cut off, a few openings have allowed the population to grasp the unprecedented violence unleashed on protesters: tens of thousands killed, mass arrests, hospitals under surveillance and overcrowded prisons.

title: Half of new immigrants in France are students or refugees
subhead: Legal immigration flows continue to rise, while economic immigration is declining and regularizations are falling, according to Interior Ministry figures published on Tuesday.

title: Work-related cancers remain a blind spot in France's public health system
subhead: A study conducted by doctors and occupational sociologists at the Avignon Hospital Center on over 500 lymphoma patients found there was a 'massive underestimation' of work-related cancers in France.

title: Paris Haute Couture Week: Chanel dazzles, Armani faces new challenge
subhead: Matthieu Blazy delivered his first light and airy haute couture show for Chanel, while Armani Privé unveiled its debut collection without Giorgio Armani.
byline: Elvire von Bardeleben and  Valentin Pérez

Why there are so many French presidential hopefuls
subhead: As a result of political fragmentation, the growing number of figures who have declared their candidacies or are thinking about doing so is making the 2027 presidential election highly uncertain, writes Le Monde's Solenn de Royer in her column.

title: Richard Ford: 'I tell my European friends how it feels not to understand my country'
subhead: The novelist expresses concern, in an op-ed for Le Monde, about the direction his country has taken under President Donald Trump. He laments that Americans do not appear to pay attention to the erosion of their constitutional rights, nor do they grasp how difficult it will be to turn back.

title: Eiffel Tower to honor 72 women scientists for posterity
subhead: On Monday, a multidisciplinary commission presented the mayor of Paris with a list of 72 names of women who will join the exclusively male scientists whose names are inscribed on the frieze of the 'Iron Lady.'
